column4: anyone know how to fix a sound problem where the volume control spits out this message when you try to open it: "No volume control GStreamer plugins and/or devices found."
okay, so noone knows how to fix the sound issue?
try reinstalling asla
I tried reinstalling alsa, do you think i should completely remove alsa and install again?
that's what i'd do...i take it that it worked fine in fiesty?
it worked until I installed a few things in synaptic that were graphics related
have you been able to run alsamix from the CLi?
no
*a;samixer
is that no you haven't tried or no it doesn't work?
when i try to run alsamixer, it spits out this message in terminal: "alsamixer: function snd_ctl_open failed for default: No such device"
ouch, looks like the device files no longer exist. Yep reinstall alsa...there might be a reconfigure, thingy
also, when I go to System>Preferences>Sound there is no default sound card in the drop down menu
i know that alsa is tied in with a bunch of other programs, would i have to delete all of them as well?
alsa shoudl be an indepenent module...others depend on it but not it on them
the reason why i ask is i went to uninstall alsa last night, and it had a list of like 20 progs it was going to delete
yeah, i think synaptic tries to clear everything that depends on it as well....you're probably best off just forcing reinstall via apt-get install -f
sudo dpkg-reconfigure linux-sound-base
i'm going to try that, give me a second
cool
it still says the same thing when i try to open the volume control
pooo. that's you left with no choice but a forced reinstall apt-get install als-utils -f etc
